Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award - News18
summary:
Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award

Published on: January 02, 2025, 21:01 IST | Source: News18

The Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports has announced the National Sports Awards 2024, honoring Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar with the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award.

  • Ministry announced the awards on January 02, 2025.
  • Manu Bhaker is the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single Olympics.
  • D Gukesh became the youngest World champion and helped the Indian team win gold at the Chess Olympiad.
  • Harmanpreet Singh led the Indian hockey team to a bronze medal and Praveen Kumar was crowned T64 champion in para athletics.
  • The awards ceremony will be held on January 17, 2025, at Rashtrapati Bhavan.
"The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India."

The recognition of these athletes highlights their contributions and achievements in Indian sports, inspiring future generations.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award

title: 10 after-dinner rituals that can help in digestion, prevent bloating - The Times of India
summary:
10 After-Dinner Rituals to Enhance Digestion and Prevent Bloating

Publication Date: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: Times of India

Implementing certain after-dinner rituals can significantly improve digestion and prevent bloating, ensuring a healthier gut.

  • Consume probiotics like yogurt or kefir.
  • Chew fennel seeds for their natural digestive qualities.
  • Take a light 10-15 minute walk after dinner for better digestion.
  • Drink warm water or herbal teas such as ginger or peppermint.
  • Stay hydrated throughout the day, but avoid large quantities of water immediately post-meal.
  • Engage in gentle stretches like yoga to relieve tension.
  • Avoid lying down for at least 2-3 hours after eating.
  • Massage your abdomen to stimulate digestion.
  • Choose light desserts with fruit or dark chocolate to satisfy cravings without overloading the digestive system.
“Every little effort put in can be rewarded with a healthy gut and overall fitness.”

Carefully incorporating these rituals into daily life can lead to improved digestive health and overall well-being.
newTitle: 10 After-Dinner Rituals to Enhance Digestion and Prevent Bloating

title: Article 370 caused spread of terrorism in Kashmir: Amit Shah - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

Published on: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah claims that Article 370 has played a critical role in fostering terrorism in Kashmir, attributing it to the notion of temporary relations between Kashmir and India.

  • Article 370 fostered separatism among Kashmiri youth, leading to terrorism.
  • Other Muslim-majority regions in India did not experience similar terrorism despite sharing borders with Pakistan.
  • Mr. Shah stated that the misconception of Kashmir's relationship with India promoted extremism.
  • The revocation of Article 370 on August 5, 2019, must be understood in the larger historical context.

“Why did terrorism not spread in other Muslim areas of the country? ... It is unfortunate that 40,000 people lost their lives,” Mr. Shah said.

The Home Minister further emphasized the importance of re-evaluating Kashmir's history and offered perspectives that could reshape national narratives.
newTitle: Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

A timeline: IDF special op. against Iranian missile production facility in Syria - The Jerusalem Post
summary:
IDF's Special Operation Against Iranian Missile Facility: A Comprehensive Overview

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Jerusalem Post

The article discusses the IDF's planning and execution of a military operation aimed at destroying an underground Iranian missile production facility in Syria, detailing the timeline and challenges faced leading up to the operation.

  • Initial planning for the operation began in August 2024.
  • The operation took place on September 8, 2024.
  • The facility was first conceptualized by Iran in 2017 and began construction shortly thereafter.
  • IDF sources indicated there were doubts about the feasibility of such an operation.
  • High-quality intelligence collection was crucial to shifting perspectives on the operation's viability.
"Many top officials were initially not convinced that such an operation would be possible."

The operation illustrates the complexities involved in addressing threats from underground military installations and showcases the IDF's strategic evolution over time in tackling such challenges.
newTitle: IDF's Special Operation Against Iranian Missile Facility: A Comprehensive Overview

title: From meteor shower to comet: Astronomical events to look forward to in Jan 2025 - The Times of India
summary:
Astronomical Events to Look Forward to in January 2025

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Unknown

January 2025 brings a dazzling lineup of astronomical events that will captivate both avid sky-watchers and casual stargazers.

  • January 3: Venus and Moon conjunction visible after sunset.
  • January 3-4: Quadrantid Meteor Shower peaks with 60 to 200 meteors per hour.
  • January 4: Occultation of Saturn by the Moon observable in select locations.
  • January 4: Earth at Perihelion, closest point to the Sun.
  • January 9-10: Venus reaches its greatest elongation.
  • January 13: Wolf Moon, marking the full moon of January.
  • January 16: Mars at opposition, appearing brighter in the sky.
  • January 29: New Moon, ideal for stargazing.
"January’s full moon, known as Wolf Moon, has great cultural significance for many cultures."

In summary, this January offers numerous celestial events that provide excellent opportunities for stargazing and appreciating the wonders of our universe.
newTitle: Astronomical Events to Look Forward to in January 2025

title: Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist - The Hindu
summary:
Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist

Published: January 02, 2025, Source: The Hindu

A combination of Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity and quantum physics may help explain the expansion of the universe from a singular entity, according to P. Ajith, an astrophysicist with the International Centre for Theoretical Sciences in Bengaluru. He presented this topic during a lecture at the Regional Science Centre and Planetarium in Kozhikode.

  • The primordial atom theory, proposed by Georges Lemaitre, is more of a narrative than a scientific fact.
  • History of cosmic understanding spans from Copernicus to Newton, shaping modern science and technology.
  • Einstein’s theory redefined gravity as a consequence of space-time effects rather than a force.
“The primordial atom is just a way of explaining what might have happened. To understand what happened then, we need to combine Einstein’s theory of relativity with quantum physics.” - P. Ajith

The integration of these scientific principles might offer profound insights into the universe's origins and evolution, highlighting the importance of continued exploration in physics.
newTitle: Key Insights on Big Bang Explained Through Relativity and Quantum Physics

title: Gautam Gambhir turns down request to 'allow Rohit Sharma to play in Sydney and retire' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Rejects Rohit Sharma's Playing Request Ahead of Sydney Test

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent turn of events, Gautam Gambhir has opted not to include Rohit Sharma in the playing XI for the final Test against Australia, prioritizing team performance over individual requests.

  • Rohit Sharma, amidst poor performance, decided to 'opt out' of the playing XI.
  • His performance in the series has been subpar, averaging just 6.20.
  • Shubman Gill is set to replace Rohit in Sydney, while KL Rahul will open the innings.
  • Gambhir's decision is influenced by the need for a win to bolster India's chances in the World Test Championship.
  • An influential cricket administrator requested Gambhir allow Rohit to play and retire on-field, which he declined.
“Everything is fine with Rohit. The head coach is there. That should be fine.” – Gautam Gambhir

The decision emphasizes Gambhir's commitment to team success as India eyes the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and a spot in the World Test Championship final.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Rejects Rohit Sharma's Playing Request Ahead of Sydney Test

Starved of Russian gas, industry shuts down in breakaway Moldovan region - Reuters
summary:
Industry Shutdown in Moldova's Breakaway Region Due to Russian Gas Cut

Date: Jan 2, 2023 Source: Reuters

The cutting of Russian gas supplies to Moldova's breakaway Transdniestria region has resulted in the closure of all industrial companies except food producers, affecting the territory's economy severely.

  • All companies except food producers have been idled.
  • The region of about 450,000 people is experiencing immediate economic impact from the halt of Russian gas supplies.
  • Officials warn of irreversible changes if the situation persists.
  • Local energy company has cut heating and hot water for households.
"It is too early to judge how the situation will develop... The problem is so extensive that if it is not resolved for a long time, we will already have irreversible changes." - Sergei Obolonik, First Deputy Prime Minister of Transdniestria

The situation is critical as Moldova seeks to reduce energy consumption and secure alternative supplies, while the cut in gas supplies highlights the ongoing energy disputes and geopolitical tensions in the region.
newTitle: Industry Shutdown in Moldova's Breakaway Region Due to Russian Gas Cut

summary:
'Kejriwal in love with bogus voters': BJP slams AAP over voter list 'discrepancy'

Date: January 4, 2024   |   Source: Times of India

The BJP has accused AAP of having leaders with dual voter registrations, targeting party chief Arvind Kejriwal during a press conference.

  • BJP claims Kejriwal has a 'love for bogus voters'.
  • Allegations include AAP MP Sanjay Singh having dual voter registrations.
  • BJP seeks legal action against Singh for alleged electoral discrepancies.
  • Sanjay Singh defends himself, stating proper process was followed for voter registration changes.
  • BJP leader suggests further investigations into dual registrations among AAP officials.
Sachdeva claimed, "What dignity does a person have when he is already out on bail and creates double voter registrations even while serving as a Member of Parliament?"

The BJP's allegations highlight ongoing tensions between the two parties, particularly regarding electoral integrity and voter registration.

title: Scientists find a key to delay brain ageing - The Times of India
summary:
Scientists Find a Key to Delay Brain Ageing

Date: January 2, 2023 Source: IANS

In a breakthrough study, scientists have uncovered a crucial mechanism that may help delay age-related cognitive decline. This research identifies the excitation-mitochondrial DNA transcription coupling (E-TCmito), which connects neuronal activity to mitochondrial function.

  • Scientists investigated the role of mitochondrial transcription in cognition using young and aged mice.
  • They discovered that E-TCmito is vital for maintaining synaptic and mitochondrial health in the brain.
  • Boosting E-TCmito in aged mice improved their cognitive functions.
  • The findings offer new potential targets for combating age-related cognitive disorders like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's diseases.
“Through an impressive combination of innovative tools, innovative physiology, and behavior experiments, Li et al. provide key insights into mitochondrial biology in the aging mammalian brain.” - Deniz Bingul and Scott Owen

This research may pave the way for new therapies aimed at treating age-related cognitive decline, making significant strides in our understanding of brain aging.
newTitle: Scientists Discover Mechanism to Delay Brain Aging

summary:

Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV

Indian cricket team skipper Rohit Sharma is set to be rested for the fifth Test against Australia due to poor form, with reports indicating he managed only 31 runs in his last three matches of the series, while Shubman Gill is likely to replace him.

  • Rohit Sharma has faced challenges during the test series, scoring poorly.
  • An influential cricket administrator's request to retain him was turned down by Gambhir.
  • Gambhir's priority remains India's chances in the World Test Championship (WTC) final.
  • If not played, Rohit would become the first Indian captain dropped for poor performance in a Test.
  • Jasprit Bumrah might take over leadership if Rohit is sidelined.
“Performance is the only thing that would keep a player in the dressing room helmed by him.” - Gautam Gambhir

This decision highlights the emphasis on performance as India aims to compete for the WTC final. Whether Rohit plays or not may significantly impact his future in Test cricket.

title: High-level meeting held; government shortlists Ekta Sthal, Vijay Ghat for Manmohan Singh’s memorial - The Indian Express
summary:
Government Shortlists Sites for Manmohan Singh Memorial

Date: Latest Update
Source: The Indian Express

The government has identified three potential sites for a memorial dedicated to former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who passed away on December 26. The sites include Ekta Sthal, Vijay Ghat, and Rashtriya Smriti Sthal.

  • Top officials from the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs convened to discuss potential memorial sites.
  • A final announcement regarding the chosen site is expected soon.
  • Ekta Sthal currently houses a memorial for former President Giani Zail Singh, while Vijay Ghat honors Lal Bahadur Shastri.
  • Urban Development Secretary K Srinivas will inform Singh’s family about the shortlisted sites.
  • The move follows a request from the Congress party for a memorial, amidst controversies regarding Singh's last rites.
“The government had already identified potential locations for a memorial and communicated this to Singh’s family,” stated BJP president J P Nadda.

In conclusion, the decision regarding Manmohan Singh’s memorial highlights the ongoing political dialogue and concerns surrounding his legacy.
newTitle: Government Shortlists Sites for Manmohan Singh Memorial

Lalu Yadav's offer to Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for tie-up sparks buzz; Tejashwi downplays

Political discussions in Bihar are heating up as Lalu Yadav has suggested a potential realignment with chief minister Nitish Kumar. Although Kumar downplays the suggestion, speculation regarding a fresh political alliance has emerged ahead of upcoming elections.

  • RJD leader Lalu Yadav extends an offer to Nitish Kumar to rejoin the INDIA bloc.
  • Nitish Kumar responds cryptically to media queries about the offer.
  • Tejashwi Yadav, Lalu's son, downplays his father's remarks, stating there will be no realignment.
  • Political leaders from JD(U) and BJP dismiss the idea of a realignment as unrealistic.
"In politics, everything is possible. There are no permanent friends or enemies in politics." - RJD senior leader Bhai Birendra

The political landscape in Bihar remains dynamic as parties prepare for the upcoming elections, suggesting that political alignments could shift significantly.

title: Sebi clubs fund diversion, disclosure violation probes against ZEE, Punit Goenka and Subhash Chandra | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Sebi Combines Probes Against ZEE, Punit Goenka, and Subhash Chandra

Publication Date: January 2, 2023

Source: Live Mint

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has consolidated ongoing investigations into Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd (ZEEL) and its executives over allegations of fund diversion and disclosure violations.

  • Sebi has clubbed investigations against ZEEL, CEO Punit Goenka, and former chairman Subhash Chandra.
  • Allegations include failure to comply with listing regulations and corporate governance violations.
  • A show-cause notice was issued in July 2022, questioning the actions of the involved parties.
  • Settlement applications filed by Zee and Goenka were rejected in April 2023, leading to further investigations.
  • An interim order barred Chandra and Goenka from holding key positions in listed companies amid the allegations.
  • Sebi's investigations into LODR violations will now be included in the funds diversion probe.
  • The proceeding against the company and executives were dropped to avoid multiplicity of cases.
“The allegations in the show-cause notice of 6 July 2022 issued by the adjudicating officer are to be subsumed with the findings of the further investigation carried out by SEBI in the instant (funds diversion) matter.”

This development is significant as it centralizes the investigation process and streamlines legal proceedings within the corporate governance framework.
newTitle: Sebi Combines Probes Against ZEE, Punit Goenka, and Subhash Chandra

title: 6 Stunning Pictures Of Quasars and Black Holes Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
summary:
6 Stunning Pictures Of Quasars and Black Holes Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Jan 2, 2025 Source: Times Now

This article highlights six breathtaking images of quasars and black holes captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the beauty and complexity of these astronomical phenomena.

  • Markarian 231: Two black holes in a close orbital dance illuminating the galaxy’s center.
  • Markarian 817: A spiral galaxy with blue star clusters surrounding an active supermassive black hole.
  • Quasar 3C 273: One of the closest quasars, its light took 2.5 billion years to reach Earth.
  • NGC 4438: A black hole exhibiting chaotic behavior with massive outflows of hot gas.
  • Quasar Tsunamis: Showcases the immense energy produced by quasars.
"Quasars produce immense energy, powered by a supermassive black hole consuming surrounding matter."

This collection of images not only illustrates the stunning visuals provided by the Hubble Space Telescope but also emphasizes the crucial role that these celestial bodies play in the universe.
newTitle: 6 Stunning Pictures Of Quasars and Black Holes Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Mars, Venus, Saturn and Jupiter to align the night sky in January: Here's the exact date and time - India TV News
summary:
January Planet Parade: Mars, Venus, Saturn, and Jupiter Align in the Night Sky

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: India TV News

This January, stargazers and astronomers will witness a spectacular alignment of four major planets: Mars, Venus, Saturn, and Jupiter, with the best view on January 17 and 18.

  • Mars will reach its brightest point on January 15-16, sitting prominently in the constellation Gemini.
  • Venus and Saturn will appear unusually close together, separated by only a few finger widths.
  • Jupiter will complete the planetary lineup, shining brightly in the sky.
  • Uranus and Neptune will also be visible for those with telescopes.
  • This event is referred to as a 'planet parade' by astronomers, highlighting its rarity and significance.
Mars’ opposition not only offers a visual delight but also provides ideal conditions for spacecraft launches and interplanetary missions.

This alignment not only captivates observers but also holds potential significance for future space exploration endeavors.
newTitle: January Planet Parade: Mars, Venus, Saturn, and Jupiter Align in the Night Sky

The petition challenging the Madhya Pradesh High Court's decision on the Bhojshala complex survey is now set to be reviewed alongside cases regarding the validity of the Places of Worship Act, 1991.

title: US considers potential rules to restrict or bar Chinese drones - Reuters
summary:
US Considers Potential Rules to Restrict or Bar Chinese Drones

Date: January 2, 2024

Source: Reuters

The U.S. Commerce Department is evaluating new rules aimed at restricting or banning Chinese drones due to national security concerns, with public comments accepted until March 4.

  • The U.S. cites potential threats from Chinese and Russian manufacturers.
  • China dominates U.S. commercial drone sales.
